request.description:
### Get Users

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of users from the server.

**Request Body**  
This request does not require a request body.

**Response**  
The response will include an array of user objects, where each object contains the following fields:

- `id` (number): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `gender` (string): The gender of the user.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the user.
    

Example response:

``` json
[
    {
        "id": 0,
        "name": "",
        "email": "",
        "gender": "",
        "status": ""
    }
]

 ```

request.description:
### Add New User

This endpoint allows you to add a new user to the system.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): The name of the user.
    
- `gender` (string, required): The gender of the user.
    
- `email` (string, required): The email address of the user.
    
- `status` (string, required): The status of the user.
    

#### Response

Upon successful creation, the endpoint returns the details of the newly created user including:

- `id` (integer): The unique identifier of the user.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `gender` (string): The gender of the user.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the user.
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "id": 0,
    "name": "",
    "email": "",
    "gender": "",
    "status": ""
}

 ```

item.description:
To verify if the API responds on various browsers, browser versions and OS.  
This is done by simulating the "User-Agent" request header in Postman.

To get User-Agent List visit; [https://www.whatismybrowser.com/guides/the-latest-user-agent/edge](https://www.whatismybrowser.com/guides/the-latest-user-agent/edge)

request.description:
### Get Users

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of users from the server.

**Request Body**  
This request does not require a request body.

**Response**  
The response will include an array of user objects, where each object contains the following fields:

- `id` (number): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `gender` (string): The gender of the user.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the user.
    

Example response:

``` json
[
    {
        "id": 0,
        "name": "",
        "email": "",
        "gender": "",
        "status": ""
    }
]

 ```

(iv) Refer the global variables in other dependent APIs

request.description:
### Get Users

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of users from the server.

**Request Body**  
This request does not require a request body.

**Response**  
The response will include an array of user objects, where each object contains the following fields:

- `id` (number): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `gender` (string): The gender of the user.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the user.
    

Example response:

``` json
[
    {
        "id": 0,
        "name": "",
        "email": "",
        "gender": "",
        "status": ""
    }
]

 ```

item.description:
Here, We test the APIs by hitting them contineously for "x" number of seconds and evaluate if the sever responds with 2xx response.

Load test has to be simulated with different test data and different User-Agent so that it looks realistic. Hence, all test data have to be unique.

- additional payload fields
    
- empty payload values

ii. Broken Endpoints Testing
